poem:
Title: "The Dance of Democracy"

In the great courthouse of life,
Trump is twirling, ready to sue the judge,
a spectacle as loud as a dropped gavel.
The clock tolls its daily objection,
yet this ballet of legalities spins on.
Each unheard petition the whisper of parchment,
abeam the silent ink of the New York Times.
Witnessing, we are but shadows cast in its stark headlights.
